hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Volatility Compression Reversal
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a significant news event (e.g., exchange announcement, regulatory headline), a sharp, high-volume price spike that fails to sustain and is followed by 4 hours of compressed volatility (ATR(4h) < 50% of ATR(24h)) will lead to a directional reversal towards the pre-news price level within the next 12 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Sharp news-driven moves often represent 'hot money' overreaction. A subsequent collapse in volatility suggests momentum exhaustion and a lack of follow-through, increasing probability of reversion as short-term traders exit positions. The pre-news VWAP acts as a natural anchor.
entry_conditions: Asset experiences >5% absolute price move within 1 hour of a major news headline (categorized by news sentiment API)
Volume during spike > 200% of 24h average volume
Following the spike, price enters consolidation: ATR(4h) < 0.5 * ATR(24h) for 4 consecutive hours
Entry on close of 4th hour of compression, in direction opposite to initial spike

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to within 1.5% of the VWAP from the 1-hour period immediately preceding the news event
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves 3% beyond the extreme of the initial spike

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 55% of such setups result in a continuation move beyond the initial spike extreme before the 12-hour time exit, indicating the news catalyst has fundamentally altered the price discovery process.
